comments.text: +michael richard The other ones are Amity, Dauntless, Candor and Erudite :)

comments.text: +LuuvAiishaa Yeah i got it, so Abnegation and what's the other one?
comments.author: michael richard

comments.text:
+michael richard Kind of. Divergent IS another set but not in terms of 
factions since, technically, in the books, being a divergent is so rare 
that there wasn't a separate faction for it, and of course humans fear the 
unknown and since being a divergent was so rare that it messed up their 
"order", they thought it was dangerous and wanted to hunt all divergents 
down to eliminate the "danger". Because of this, divergents were hidden 
within the factions, choosing which one they wanted to be in. Shailene's 
character is a divergent but she doesn't find that out until they do a test 
that all 16 year olds undergo, where they get to choose which faction they 
want to be in. Before the age of 16, people have to stay with their 
family's faction, and Tris' (her character's) family was in the faction 
'Abnegation' - so Caleb was originally in Abnegation before they chose to 
separate. Therefore, a Stiff! =) Haha sorry for that very long explanation 
:3
comments.author: LuuvAiishaa

comments.text:
+LuuvAiishaa SO theres 2 sets, abdignation and divergents? And Shailenes 
character was divergent?
comments.author: michael richard

comments.text:
+michael richard haha i think it was more of an evident nickname in the 
book! Maybe that's why :) it's basically the nickname the other factions 
had given abnegation. Actually, i'm not sure if it's all the other factions 
but Peter would call Tris a stiff to taunt her. As Ansel plays Caleb who 
was in Abnegation, he's also a "stiff" so ironically, him being "stiff" in 
this interview lives up to his nickname. Hope that explains it :)!
comments.author: LuuvAiishaa

comments.text:
Guys. I have no idea what you were talking about. 4 months later, a couple 
of days ago, was the first time I've ever seen Divergent. And now is the 
only time I get it. I did not mean it but it just goes to show it 
foreshadowed his real life self. He does fit in Abnegation but he is an 
Erudite now, y'all. Stop fooling yourselves. Haha. Also, let's make it more 
clearer. He has no factions anymore. Boo to the hoo.

captions.text:
- YOU'VE GOT QUITE A LIFE
GOING ON RIGHT NOW.
YOU'RE ON THE COVER.
YOU'RE 20 YEARS OLD,

ON THE COVER
OF "ENTERTAINMENT WEEKLY"
WITH SHAILENE.
AND YOU'RE BOTH--
[applause]
HOTTER THAN HOT IS WHAT YOU ARE.
THIS IS THE MOST LIKED YOUTUBE--

THE TRAILER, I GUESS,
IS ON YOUTUBE, RIGHT?

AND IT'S THE MOST LIKED
IN YOUTUBE HISTORY.

- YEAH.
- WHAT'S THAT LIKE?

- I MEAN, IT'S--WE HAVE
A REALLY CRAZY FAN BASE

TO THIS BOOK, BECAUSE
IT'S SUCH A GREAT BOOK.

- YEAH, TELL PEOPLE
ABOUT THE BOOK.

- YEAH, IT'S A BOOK--
IT'S A BOOK ABOUT--

I DON'T KNOW;
HAVE ANY OF YOU GUYS READ IT?

[cheers and applause]
SO...

YEAH, I GUESS SOME OF YOU GUYS
HAVE HEARD OF IT,

AND IT'S INTERESTING,
BECAUSE IT'S ABOUT TWO KIDS

WHO ARE TERMINALLY SICK
WITH CANCER,

BUT IT'S NOT REALLY
ABOUT CANCER.

IT'S ABOUT A BEAUTIFUL
LOVE STORY BETWEEN TWO PEOPLE.

AND I THINK PEOPLE CONNECT
TO IT SO MUCH

BECAUSE IT DOESN'T, YOU KNOW,
SAY THAT,

"OH, SICK PEOPLE
ARE LESS IMPORTANT,"

OR IT'S NOT ABOUT
A HEALTHY PERSON

LEARNING A LESSON
FROM SICK PEOPLE.

IT'S ABOUT HOW TWO PEOPLE
WITH CANCER

ARE JUST AS IMPORTANT
AS EVERYONE ELSE,

AND THEIR LOVE STORY CAN BE
JUST AS BEAUTIFUL,
IF NOT MORE.

- AND IT'S YOU AND SHAILENE
AGAIN.
YOU WORKED WITH HER AGAIN.

AND IT REALLY IS
A CRAZY FAN BASE,

AND I THINK YOU BROUGHT
SOME VIDEO.

WE HAVE B-ROLL OF--
IT'S LIKE--

YOU KNOW, LIKE A ONE DIRECTION
CONCERT OR SOMETHING, WHERE--
LOOK AT THIS.

THIS IS JUST PEOPLE WAITING
TO MEET YOU AT--

FOR WHAT REASON?
IT WAS JUST A SCREENING OR...

- WELL, WE DID, LIKE,
THESE FAN EVENTS
AROUND AMERICA.

AND IT'S JUST PEOPLE WHO ARE
SO--BIG FANS OF THE BOOK.

AND IT'S INSANE, BECAUSE,
LIKE I SAID,

IT'S A BOOK ABOUT, LIKE,
YOU KNOW, JUST TWO KIDS.

IT'S NOT ABOUT, LIKE, SOME CRAZY
ACTION FILM OR ANYTHING.

AND IT'S NOT VERY OFTEN THAT,
YOU KNOW, 5,000 PEOPLE SHOW UP.
BUT EVERY PLACE WE WENT,

THERE WERE THOUSANDS
AND THOUSANDS OF PEOPLE,
AND IT WAS INSANE.
IT WAS REALLY WEIRD FOR ME.

- THAT'S FANTASTIC.
I BET IT IS.
- YEAH, I MEAN, THIS--

- BUT YOU WERE IN "DIVERGENT"
ALSO.

- I KNOW, BUT THIS--
BUT "DIVERGENT,"

I JUST DID--
LIKE, THAT JUST HAPPENED TOO.

SO THIS IS A CRAZY FEW MONTHS
FOR ME.

IT'S LIKE--
- YES.

- LIKE, A YEAR AGO, YOU KNOW,
I WASN'T EVEN ON SOCIAL MEDIA,

AND I HAD, LIKE, 500 FOLLOWERS
ON TWITTER.
NOW IT'S, LIKE, 500,000, ALMOST.
AND IT'S LIKE--IT'S CRAZY.

- YEAH, I'M SURE
IT'S KIND OF HARD TO--

'CAUSE YOU CAN'T REALLY
SLOW IT DOWN,

BUT YOU SHOULD TRY
TO SLOW IT DOWN

SO YOU CAN GRASP IT,
'CAUSE IT'S A LOT AT ONCE.
BUT YOU'RE REALLY AMAZING,

BECAUSE YOU ENTERTAIN
THOSE PEOPLE.

I THINK YOU WERE BREAK-DANCING
FOR THAT CROWD.

DO WE HAVE THAT VIDEO OF YOU
ACTUALLY DANCING
FOR EVERYBODY WHILE THEY--

- WELL...
[laughter]

YEAH, AND THEN IT GOT, YEAH,
KIND OF--

BECAUSE I--I DON'T USUALLY
DO THAT,

AND I DON'T THINK ANY OF
THE PEOPLE IN THE CAST--
[laughter]

- SO YOU OBVIOUSLY--
DID YOU TAKE DANCE?
- YEAH, I STARTED IN DANCE.
I STARTED IN BALLET.

- YOU HAVE A SPECIAL TALENT TOO,
WHICH IS VERY IMPRESSIVE.
TELL PEOPLE WHAT YOU DO.

- OH, WELL, I--
I PAINT MINIATURES.

AND I PAINT LITTLE--
- THEY'RE INCREDIBLE.

SO, LIKE, I THINK WE HAVE
SOME PICTURES OF--

EXPLAIN WHAT--
LOOK HOW TINY THAT IS.

YOU'RE HOLDING THAT
IN YOUR HANDS,
ALTHOUGH YOU HAVE LARGE HANDS.

BUT--AND THAT IS--
LOOK AT THE DETAIL IN THAT.

HOW LONG'S IT TAKE YOU
TO DO SOMETHING LIKE THAT
ON A LITTLE TINY PEBBLE?
- WELL, YEAH, THOSE ONES--
UM, THAT ONE TOOK ME, LIKE--

I THINK I JUST SAT THERE
FOR, LIKE, TEN HOURS STRAIGHT

AND JUST DID IT
WITHOUT STOPPING.
UM, YEAH.

- NEXT TO A QUARTER,
SO YOU CAN SEE THE DETAIL
ON SOMETHING THAT SIZE.
- TO SEE HOW SMALL IT IS, YEAH.

- WELL, WE HAVE A LOT
IN COMMON,
'CAUSE I ALSO DO THE SAME THING.
[laughter]

AND SO I WANTED TO GIVE YOU
SOMETHING
FOR YOU TO HANG IN YOUR ROOM.

AND IT'S A PAINTING OF--
THAT I DID OF US.

AND, UM--
[laughter]

IF YOU WANT,
HERE'S A HAMMER AND NAILS,
AND YOU CAN HANG IT UP.

- OH, THANK YOU.
I LOVE IT.

- OKAY.
BUT--

AND--
- THANK YOU SO MUCH.

- THAT'S US.
THAT'S YOU AND I.

- THAT'S REALLY GOOD.
- YEAH, THANKS A WHOLE LOT.
- IT LOOKS A LITTLE--

IT DOESN'T REALLY LOOK LIKE
YOU PAINTED IT.

- OH, REALLY?
I DON'T KNOW WHY.
[laughter]

I DON'T KNOW WHY
IT WOULDN'T LOOK LIKE THAT.

"THE FAULT IN OUR STARS"
IS IN THEATERS JUNE 6TH.
WE'LL BE RIGHT BACK.
